Consider using `apply()` instead; `commit` writes its data to persistent storage immediately, whereas `apply` will handle it in the background

Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toLowerCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Call requires API level 23 (current min is 17): `android.content.Context#getColor`
Call requires API level 23 (current min is 17): `android.content.Context#getColor`

To get local formatting use `getDateInstance()`, `getDateTimeInstance()`, or `getTimeInstance()`, or use `new SimpleDateFormat(String template, Locale locale)` with for example `Locale.US` for ASCII dates.
issue.errorLine1: public SimpleDateFormat dfs = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS");//设置日期格式

issue.message: Potentially insecure random numbers on Android 4.3 and older. Read https://android-developers.blogspot.com/2013/08/some-securerandom-thoughts.html for more info.
issue.errorLine1: sc.init(null, new TrustManager[]{new TrustAllCerts()}, new SecureRandom());

issue.message: `verify` always returns `true`, which could cause insecure network traffic due to trusting TLS/SSL server certificates for wrong hostnames
issue.errorLine1: public boolean verify(String hostname, SSLSession session) {

issue.message: Google Play requires that apps target API level 26 or higher.
